pullRequest.title: Allow procedures to have optional arguments with default values
pullRequest.bodyText: This change allow procedure arguments to be optional with default values

nodes.bodyText:
Formatting nit: we put stream on the same line as the expression
 int optionalArgumentsCount = (int) procedure.getArguments().stream()
        .filter(...)

Same here
int providedArgumentsCount = (int) procedure.getArguments().stream()
        .filter(...)
Use toIntExact instead of cast to int, as that makes the intention clear and avoids a warning. (it won't ever be larger, but if it was, we wouldn't want to do a lossy conversion)
The is prefix is typically reserved for getters (like get but for booleans), not used for fields or parameters, so name this just required.
Nit: format {} on the same line for intentionally empty methods. We do that so it's clear that the methods are intended to be empty.
Static import methodHandle as the name stands by itself (the MethodHandleUtil prefix doesn't provide any value and actually detracts from readability)

@@ -0,0 +1,197 @@
+/*
+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
+ * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+ * You may obtain a copy of the License at
+ *
+ *     http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+ *

+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+ * limitations under the License.
+ */
+package io.prestosql.tests;
+
+import com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList;
+import io.prestosql.spi.block.MethodHandleUtil;
+import io.prestosql.spi.connector.ConnectorSession;
+import io.prestosql.spi.procedure.Procedure;
+import org.testng.annotations.Test;
+
+import java.util.List;
+
+import static io.prestosql.spi.type.VarcharType.VARCHAR;
+import static java.lang.String.format;
+import static org.testng.Assert.fail;
+
+@Test(singleThreaded = true)
+public class TestProcedureCreation
+{
+    @Test
+    public void shouldThrowExceptionWhenOptionalArgumentIsNotLast()
+    {
+        assertThrows(
+                IllegalArgumentException.class,
+                "Optional arguments should follow required ones",
+                () -> createTestProcedure(ImmutableList.of(
+                    new Procedure.Argument("name", VARCHAR, false, null),
+                    new Procedure.Argument("name2", VARCHAR, true, null))));
+
+        assertThrows(
+                IllegalArgumentException.class,
+                "Optional arguments should follow required ones",
+                () -> createTestProcedure(ImmutableList.of(
+                        new Procedure.Argument("name", VARCHAR, true, null),
+                        new Procedure.Argument("name2", VARCHAR, true, null),
+                        new Procedure.Argument("name3", VARCHAR, true, null),
+                        new Procedure.Argument("name4", VARCHAR, false, null),
+                        new Procedure.Argument("name5", VARCHAR, true, null))));
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldThrowExceptionWhenArgumentNameRepeates()
+    {
+        assertThrows(
+                IllegalArgumentException.class,
+                "Duplicate argument name: 'name'",
+                () -> createTestProcedure(ImmutableList.of(
+                        new Procedure.Argument("name", VARCHAR, false, null),
+                        new Procedure.Argument("name", VARCHAR, true, null))));
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldThrowExceptionWhenProcedureIsNonVoid()
+    {
+        assertThrows(
+                IllegalArgumentException.class,
+                "Method must return void",
+                () -> new Procedure(
+                        "schema",
+                        "name",
+                        ImmutableList.of(),
+                        MethodHandleUtil.methodHandle(Procedures.class, "funWithoutArguments")));
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldThrowExceptionWhenMethodHandleIsNull()
+    {
+        assertThrows(
+                NullPointerException.class,
+                "methodHandle is null",
+                () -> new Procedure(
+                        "schema",
+                        "name",
+                        ImmutableList.of(),
+                        null));
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldThrowExceptionWhenMethodHandleHasVarargs()
+    {
+        assertThrows(
+                IllegalArgumentException.class,
+                "Method must have fixed arity",
+                () -> new Procedure(
+                        "schema",
+                        "name",
+                        ImmutableList.of(),
+                        MethodHandleUtil.methodHandle(Procedures.class, "funWithVarargs", String[].class)));
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldThrowExceptionWhenArgumentCountDoesntMatch()
+    {
+        assertThrows(
+                IllegalArgumentException.class,
+                "Method parameter count must match arguments",
+                () -> new Procedure(
+                        "schema",
+                        "name",
+                        ImmutableList.of(
+                                new Procedure.Argument("name", VARCHAR, true, null),
+                                new Procedure.Argument("name2", VARCHAR, true, null),
+                                new Procedure.Argument("name3", VARCHAR, true, null)),
+                        MethodHandleUtil.methodHandle(Procedures.class, "fun1", ConnectorSession.class, Object.class)));

nodes.bodyText: inline this one, let's keep ctor number as low as possible
org.assertj.core.api.Assertions#assertThatThrownBy is recommended

+ * limitations under the License.
+ */
+package io.prestosql.tests;
+
+import com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList;
+import io.prestosql.spi.connector.ConnectorSession;
+import io.prestosql.spi.procedure.Procedure;
+import org.testng.annotations.Test;
+
+import java.util.List;
+
+import static io.prestosql.spi.block.MethodHandleUtil.methodHandle;
+import static io.prestosql.spi.type.VarcharType.VARCHAR;
+import static java.lang.String.format;
+import static org.testng.Assert.fail;
+
+@Test(singleThreaded = true)
+public class TestProcedureCreation
+{
+    @Test
+    public void shouldThrowExceptionWhenOptionalArgumentIsNotLast()
+    {
+        assertThrows(
+                IllegalArgumentException.class,
+                "Optional arguments should follow required ones",
+                () -> createTestProcedure(ImmutableList.of(
+                    new Procedure.Argument("name", VARCHAR, false, null),
+                    new Procedure.Argument("name2", VARCHAR, true, null))));
+
+        assertThrows(
+                IllegalArgumentException.class,
+                "Optional arguments should follow required ones",
+                () -> createTestProcedure(ImmutableList.of(
+                        new Procedure.Argument("name", VARCHAR, true, null),
+                        new Procedure.Argument("name2", VARCHAR, true, null),
+                        new Procedure.Argument("name3", VARCHAR, true, null),
+                        new Procedure.Argument("name4", VARCHAR, false, null),
+                        new Procedure.Argument("name5", VARCHAR, true, null))));
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldThrowExceptionWhenArgumentNameRepeates()
+    {
+        assertThrows(
+                IllegalArgumentException.class,
+                "Duplicate argument name: 'name'",
+                () -> createTestProcedure(ImmutableList.of(
+                        new Procedure.Argument("name", VARCHAR, false, null),
+                        new Procedure.Argument("name", VARCHAR, true, null))));
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldThrowExceptionWhenProcedureIsNonVoid()
+    {
+        assertThrows(
+                IllegalArgumentException.class,
+                "Method must return void",
+                () -> new Procedure(
+                        "schema",
+                        "name",
+                        ImmutableList.of(),
+                        methodHandle(Procedures.class, "funWithoutArguments")));
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldThrowExceptionWhenMethodHandleIsNull()
+    {
+        assertThrows(
+                NullPointerException.class,
+                "methodHandle is null",
+                () -> new Procedure(
+                        "schema",
+                        "name",
+                        ImmutableList.of(),
+                        null));
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldThrowExceptionWhenMethodHandleHasVarargs()
+    {
+        assertThrows(
+                IllegalArgumentException.class,
+                "Method must have fixed arity",
+                () -> new Procedure(
+                        "schema",
+                        "name",
+                        ImmutableList.of(),
+                        methodHandle(Procedures.class, "funWithVarargs", String[].class)));
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldThrowExceptionWhenArgumentCountDoesntMatch()
+    {
+        assertThrows(
+                IllegalArgumentException.class,
+                "Method parameter count must match arguments",
+                () -> new Procedure(
+                        "schema",
+                        "name",
+                        ImmutableList.of(
+                                new Procedure.Argument("name", VARCHAR, true, null),
+                                new Procedure.Argument("name2", VARCHAR, true, null),
+                                new Procedure.Argument("name3", VARCHAR, true, null)),
+                        methodHandle(Procedures.class, "fun1", ConnectorSession.class, Object.class)));
+    }
+
+    private static Procedure createTestProcedure(List<Procedure.Argument> arguments)
+    {
+        int argumentsCount = arguments.size();
+        String functionName = "fun" + argumentsCount;
+
+        Class<?>[] clazzes = new Class<?>[argumentsCount + 1];
+        clazzes[0] = ConnectorSession.class;
+
+        for (int i = 0; i < argumentsCount; i++) {
+            clazzes[i + 1] = Object.class;
+        }
+
+        return new Procedure(
+                "schema",
+                "name",
+                arguments,
+                methodHandle(Procedures.class, functionName, clazzes));
+    }
+
+    private static <T extends Throwable> void assertThrows(Class<T> exception, String message, Runnable runnable)

nodes.bodyText: remove requireNonNull, since it's primitive

Any reason not to use org.assertj.core.api.Assertions#assertThatThrownBy directly?
it wouldn't be longer, yet no help needed:
assertThatThrownBy(() -> new Procedure(
        "schema",
        "name",
        ImmutableList.of(),
        methodHandle(Procedures.class, "funWithVarargs", String[].class)))
        .isInstanceOf(IllegalArgumentException.class)
        .hasMessage("Method must have fixed arity");

nodes.bodyText: bump

commit.message: Allow procedures to have optional arguments with default values

afterCommit.message: Allow procedures to have optional arguments with default values
